title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
3 Points

1 - for correct natural monopoly graph.

1/2 - for correct relationship between demand and MR.

1/2 - for correct price.

1/2 - for correct quantity.

1/2 - for correct economic profits.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

1 - for correct natural monopoly graph.

1/2 - for correct relationship between demand and MR.

1/2 - for correct price.

1/2 - for correct quantity.

1/2 - for correct economic profits.

The student earns one of the following points:

1 - for correct natural monopoly graph.

1/2 - for correct relationship between demand and MR.

1/2 - for correct price.

1/2 - for correct quantity.

1/2 - for correct economic profits.

The student earns two of the following points:

1 - for correct natural monopoly graph.

1/2 - for correct relationship between demand and MR.

1/2 - for correct price.

1/2 - for correct quantity.

1/2 - for correct economic profits.

The student earns all of the following points:

1 - for correct natural monopoly graph.

1/2 - for correct relationship between demand and MR.

1/2 - for correct price.

1/2 - for correct quantity.

1/2 - for correct economic profits.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 Point

  • 1/2 - for D = ATC = P.

  • 1/2 - for D = MC = P.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

  • 1/2 - for D = ATC = P.

  • 1/2 - for D = MC = P.

The student earns all of the following points:

  • 1/2 - for D = ATC = P.

  • 1/2 - for D = MC = P.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
One point is earned three ways:

  1. (Shut down.) Proper use of the natural monopoly case where P<ATC at P = MC

  2. (Shut down.) Student who has not previously used the natural monopoly explicitly states that a natural monopoly results in P<ATC when P = MC

  3. (Produce in the short run.) Student has used the classic monopoly case and has P>ATC where P = MC.
descriptions:
The student earns none of the following points:

One point is earned three ways:

  1. (Shut down.) Proper use of the natural monopoly case where P<ATC at P = MC

  2. (Shut down.) Student who has not previously used the natural monopoly explicitly states that a natural monopoly results in P<ATC when P = MC

  3. (Produce in the short run.) Student has used the classic monopoly case and has P>ATC where P = MC.

The student earns all of the following points:

One point is earned three ways:

  1. (Shut down.) Proper use of the natural monopoly case where P<ATC at P = MC

  2. (Shut down.) Student who has not previously used the natural monopoly explicitly states that a natural monopoly results in P<ATC when P = MC

  3. (Produce in the short run.) Student has used the classic monopoly case and has P>ATC where P = MC.
